title: Break and Continue
description: Learn to control loop flow with break and continue statements

content.introduction:
Sometimes you need more control over loop execution. The `break` statement lets you exit a loop early, while `continue` lets you skip the rest of the current iteration and move to the next one.

These statements give you fine-grained control over loop behavior.

### What You'll Learn
- Using break to exit loops early
- Using continue to skip iterations
- When to use break vs continue
- Breaking from nested loops
- Best practices for loop control

concepts.title: Break Statement
concepts.description: Immediately exits the current loop, continuing execution after the loop

concepts.title: Continue Statement
concepts.description: Skips the rest of the current iteration and starts the next iteration

concepts.title: Early Exit
concepts.description: Break allows you to exit a loop when a condition is met, even if the loop condition is still true

concepts.title: Nested Loop Control
concepts.description: Break only exits the innermost loop; to exit outer loops requires different logic

exercises.title: First Divisor Finder
exercises.description: Find the first number between 2 and 10 that divides 100 evenly. Use break to exit when found.
hints: Use break to exit the loop

exercises.title: Skip Negative Numbers
exercises.description: Sum numbers from an array of values: 5, -3, 8, -1, 12, 4. Skip negative numbers using continue.
hints: If negative, use continue to skip

exercises.title: Stop on Sentinel
exercises.description: Read numbers until -1 is entered (sentinel value). Sum all numbers except the sentinel. Use break to exit.
hints: The -1 should not be added to sum

exercises.title: Prime Number Checker
exercises.description: Check if 17 is prime by testing divisibility from 2 to 16. Use break to exit early if a divisor is found.
hints: If true, set isPrime to False
Use break to exit (no need to check more)

content.summary:
Great job! You've learned:

- **Break statement**: Exit a loop immediately
- **Continue statement**: Skip to the next iteration
- **Early exit patterns**: Using break to stop when a condition is met
- **Filtering patterns**: Using continue to skip unwanted values
- **Nested loop control**: Managing break and continue in nested structures

Break and continue give you powerful control over loop execution!
